description.para: Waits for a thread to exit within a specified time.

param_note.para: The number of milliseconds to wait.

tr.td: Function succeeds in waiting for a thread to exit in a specified time.
Thread is not started yet, the state is ThreadState_Unstarted.

remarks.para: The current thread calls this method to wait for the associated thread to exit. The current thread is put to the waiting list and is called after the associated thread terminates or time is out. The current execution thread waits for the associated thread to exit in specified time. If the associated thread does not exit by the end of the interval because the request to terminate is denied, then S_TIMED_OUT is returned to the calling procedure. E_FAIL is returned if the thread is not started. The largest possible value of a 32-bit integer represents infinity on the operating system. When ticks equals INFINITE, the current process waits until the associated process is finished or till it gets interrupted by another thread.

system.system_name: Windows 2000 or later; Elastos 2.0 or later.
